intro: Helipterum cirratum, commonly known as the curlyhead or curlycup, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery bracts that surround the flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and they bloom during the spring and summer months. Helipterum cirratum is a low-growing perennial that is well adapted to withstand drought conditions.
